cova.core

Class ConstraintAnalysis

  • java.lang.Object
    • cova.vasco.InterProceduralAnalysis<M,N,A>
      • cova.vasco.ForwardInterProceduralAnalysis<soot.SootMethod,soot.Unit,Abstraction>
        • cova.core.ConstraintAnalysis

  • public class ConstraintAnalysis
extends ForwardInterProceduralAnalysis<soot.SootMethod,soot.Unit,Abstraction>
    The Class ConstraintAnalysis defines all flow functions for handling constraints.

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • initContext

        protected Context<soot.SootMethod,soot.Unit,Abstraction> initContext(soot.SootMethod method,
                                                                     Abstraction entryValue)
        Description copied from class: ForwardInterProceduralAnalysis
        Creates a new value context and initialises data flow values for its nodes.

        The following steps are performed:

        1. Construct the context.
        2. Initialise IN/OUT for all nodes and add them to the work-list
        3. Initialise the IN of entry points with a copy of the given entry value.
        4. Add this new context to the given method's mapping.
        5. Add this context to the global work-list.

        Overrides:
        initContext in class ForwardInterProceduralAnalysis<soot.SootMethod,soot.Unit,Abstraction>
        Parameters:
        method - the method whose context to create
        entryValue - the data flow value at the entry of this method
        Returns:
        the context

        public Abstraction normalFlowFunction(Context<soot.SootMethod,soot.Unit,Abstraction> context,
                                      soot.Unit node,
                                      soot.Unit succ,
                                      Abstraction in)
        Description copied from class: ForwardInterProceduralAnalysis
        Processes the intra-procedural flow function of a statement that does not contain a method call.

        Parameters:

        node - the statement whose flow function to process
        succ - the succ
        in - the data flow value before the statement
        Returns:
        the data flow value after the statement

      • boundaryValue

        public Abstraction boundaryValue(soot.SootMethod entryPoint)
        Description copied from class: InterProceduralAnalysis
        Returns the initial data flow value at the program entry points. For forward analyses this is the IN value at the ENTRY to each entry method, while for backward analyses this is the OUT value at the EXIT to each entry method.

        Note that this method will be called exactly once per entry point specified by the program representation.

        Specified by:
        boundaryValue in class InterProceduralAnalysis<soot.SootMethod,soot.Unit,Abstraction>
        Parameters:
        entryPoint - an entry point specified by the program representation
        Returns:
        the data flow value at the boundary
        See Also:
        ProgramRepresentation.getEntryPoints()

      • programRepresentation

        public ProgramRepresentation<soot.SootMethod,soot.Unit> programRepresentation()
        Description copied from class: InterProceduralAnalysis
        Returns a program representation on top of which the inter-procedural analysis runs. The program representation is used to build control flow graphs of individual procedures and resolve targets of virtual call sites.
        Specified by:
        programRepresentation in class InterProceduralAnalysis<soot.SootMethod,soot.Unit,Abstraction>
        Returns:
        The program representation underlying this analysis
